page.title: 12Changing times
page.content: Coulsdon used to be a farming community, but only two farms remain, Woodplace and Hooley. Woodplace sustained an arson attempt during this year when old vehicles housed there were damaged by fire, and a mugging occurred three days later. Hooley farm used to be a dairy farm but it was changed into a stud and donkey breeding farm recently. Portnalls, Bradmore, Tollers, Marlpit and Placehouse farm have now disappeared as farms but are remembered in houses and road names. The area now has a council estate and a large area of detached and semi-detached houses. Many people have more hi-tec things like : dishwashers, telephones, tumble-driers, videos, hi-fi systems and televisions. General changes are more litter, more cars and vandalism.
